diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Cholecystitis, Clostridium Difficile Infection, Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe dizziness, weakness, chest pressure, and dyspnea, and had an electrocardiogram revealing new inferior Q waves and 1-2mm ST elevations. Initial troponin was elevated at 2.6, indicating myocardial injury. Cardiac catheterization demonstrated severe multivessel disease, which supports the diagnosis of Coronary Artery Disease.
